p: The H9N2 lineage was found to have a mean substitution rate of 4.45×10 −3 ( Table 2), with a constant rate of 4.9×10 −3 in the majority of branches (red) and a low rate (2.6×10 −3) in a small number of branches (blue) ( Figure 4-D). The substitution rates with the equine N7 lineage decreased from earlier branches (red) (3.4×10 −3) to late branches (blue) (1.6×10 −3) and averaged at 2.65×10 −3 ( Figure 4-E). The influenza B Yama88 viruses has a mean substitution rate of 2.3×10 −3 ( Table 2), with a consistent rate of 2.4×10 −3 in the majority of branches (red) and a rate of 1.5×10 −3 in a small number of branches (blue) ( Figure 4-F). Different rate heterogeneity patterns were also found in other lineages (Data available from authors on request).
